title: Issue 302
summary: Easter special bumper issue. Now with moar MAUI

items.title: Happy Easter!
items.description:
Hi everyone.

This is a bumper Easter edition of Weekly Xamarin. For those keen observers out there you may have noticed we missed an edition last week (sorry about that) - but that just means you have even more great content for the long weekend. ;-)

I want to send thanks to people who submitted articles: Micha≈Ç ≈ªo≈Çnieruk, Vladislav Antonyuk, Vadim Sedov and Matt Goldman. As a reminder, if you have some articles you think should be in the newsletter - let us know by submitting it here: https://bit.ly/WeeklyXamarinSubmit

Happy Easter and see you next week (really).

‚ù§

Kym
items.description_markdown:
Hi everyone.

This is a bumper Easter edition of Weekly Xamarin. For those keen observers out there you may have noticed we missed an edition last week (sorry about that) - but that just means you have even more great content for the long weekend. ;-)

I want to send thanks to people who submitted articles: Micha≈Ç ≈ªo≈Çnieruk, Vladislav Antonyuk, Vadim Sedov and Matt Goldman.  As a reminder, if you have some articles you think should be in the newsletter - let us know by submitting it here: [https://bit.ly/WeeklyXamarinSubmit](https://bit.ly/WeeklyXamarinSubmit)

Happy Easter and see you next week (really).

‚ù§

Kym

items.title: Automagic Tenant Config for Mobile Apps
items.description:

items.title: Hyperion for Xamarin.Android
items.description:
Hyperion is a hidden plugin drawer that can easily be integrated into any app. The drawer sits discreetly üôä under the app so that it is there when you need it and out of the way when you don't. Hyperion plugins are designed to make inspection of your app quick and simple.

Hyperion-Xamarin.Android by Vadim Sedov
items.description_markdown:
Hyperion is a hidden plugin drawer that can easily be integrated into any app. The drawer sits discreetly üôä under the app so that it is there when you need it and out of the way when you don't. Hyperion plugins are designed to make inspection of your app quick and simple.

items.title: Animating Page Transitions in Xamarin Forms
items.description:

In this blog post Charlin introduces that amazing library called Xamarin.Plugin.SharedTransitions which allows you to take your page transitions to the next level.

items.description_markdown:

items.title: Shiny all the things - writing testable code
items.description:
Shiny all the things as they say. If you aren't using Shiny for your Xamarin.Forms or Uno Platform apps, the question is why? We see a lot of people excited about UI libraries these days. While UI is always an important ingredient of any successful app, no app is complete without a resilient and testable architecture. This is one of the reasons why I use Shiny in all of my apps today. But what is Shiny, and why should you be using it?

Shiny all the things - writing testable code by Dan Siegel
items.description_markdown:
Shiny all the things as they say. If you aren't using Shiny for your Xamarin.Forms or Uno Platform apps, the question is why? We see a lot of people excited about UI libraries these days. While UI is always an important ingredient of any successful app, no app is complete without a resilient and testable architecture. This is one of the reasons why I use Shiny in all of my apps today. But what is Shiny, and why should you be using it?

[**Shiny all the things - writing testable code**](https://dansiegel.net/post/2021/03/12/shiny-all-the-things-writing-testable-code) by [Dan Siegel](https://twitter.com/danjsiegel)

embedded_links.title: **Shiny all the things - writing testable code**

items.title: Code Generation from XAML in Visual Studio 2019!
items.description:
Visual Studio 2019 version 16.9 introduced one of the most amazing features ever... Auto code generation directly from your XAML! Turn your Bindings and Commands directly into source code in your code behind or view model!

Code Generation from XAML in Visual Studio 2019! (WPF, UWP, & Xamarin.Forms) by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
Visual Studio 2019 version 16.9 introduced one of the most amazing features ever... Auto code generation directly from your XAML! Turn your Bindings and Commands directly into source code in your code behind or view model!

[**Code Generation from XAML in Visual Studio 2019! (WPF, UWP, & Xamarin.Forms)**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YX04sxwLMBE) by [James Montemagno](https://channel9.msdn.com/niners/jamesmontemagno)

items.title: Amazing Data Visualization with CarouselView in Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
We all know the CarouselView. Just look at your home screen on your device; swiping left and right for your icons, one big carousel. In this video we will learn about the CarouselView in Xamarin.Forms. How to implement it with data binding, item templates and explore the numerous APIs.

Amazing Data Visualization with CarouselView in Xamarin.Forms by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
We all know the CarouselView. Just look at your home screen on your device; swiping left and right for your icons, one big carousel. In this video we will learn about the CarouselView in Xamarin.Forms. How to implement it with data binding, item templates and explore the numerous APIs.

[**Amazing Data Visualization with CarouselView in Xamarin.Forms**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y0X15M_Acdc) by [Gerald Versluis](https://blog.verslu.is/author/admin/)

embedded_links.title: **Amazing Data Visualization with CarouselView in Xamarin.Forms**

items.title: IndicatorView for your CarouselView in Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
Gerald has a look at the IndicatorView. With this control you can make clear to your users where they are in the CarouselView and if they can still swipe left or right. We will see how to do a basic implementation setting IndicatorColor, IndicatorSize and hooking it up to the CarouselView.

IndicatorView for your CarouselView in Xamarin.Forms by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
Gerald has a look at the IndicatorView. With this control you can make clear to your users where they are in the CarouselView and if they can still swipe left or right. We will see how to do a basic implementation setting IndicatorColor, IndicatorSize and hooking it up to the CarouselView.

[**IndicatorView for your CarouselView in Xamarin.Forms**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MRTAvkhFoWw) by [Gerald Versluis](https://blog.verslu.is/author/admin/)

items.title: Xamarin Community Toolkit - Forget Time Zones with DateTimeOffsetConverter
items.description:
In this episode we will learn everything about the DateTimeOffsetConverter that is included in the Xamarin Community Toolkit. Mark Allibone knows from first-hand experience that sometimes, in a backend, dates are stored as an offset. To not be bother with all kinds of time zone hassles, he wrote the DateTimeOffsetConverter. And now, Mark has contributed that converter to the Xamarin Community Toolkit so everyone can benefit!

Xamarin Community Toolkit - Forget Time Zones with DateTimeOffsetConverter by The Xamarin Show
items.description_markdown:
In this episode we will learn everything about the DateTimeOffsetConverter that is included in the Xamarin Community Toolkit. Mark Allibone knows from first-hand experience that sometimes, in a backend, dates are stored as an offset. To not be bother with all kinds of time zone hassles, he wrote the DateTimeOffsetConverter. And now, Mark has contributed that converter to the Xamarin Community Toolkit so everyone can benefit!


[**Xamarin Community Toolkit - Forget Time Zones with DateTimeOffsetConverter**](https://channel9.msdn.com/Shows/XamarinShow/Xamarin-Community-Toolkit-Forget-Time-Zones-with-DateTimeOffsetConverter) by [The Xamarin Show](https://channel9.msdn.com/shows/xamarinshow)

embedded_links.title: **Xamarin Community Toolkit - Forget Time Zones with DateTimeOffsetConverter**

items.title: Building Our First Microservice | The Xamarin Show
items.description:
This week, James is joined by Nish Anil who is here to walk us through building our very first Microservice for our mobile apps with .NET, ASP.NET Core, Docker, Kubernetes, and more! He shows how to switch from development to production without changing a line of code with the power of Microservices!

items.title: Merge Conflict 246: Breaking out of the Desktop App Sandbox
items.description:
Putting apps into the app store is amazing, but the frameworks limit your ability as an app developer to do certain things on the desktop. We discuss how to keep long running processing going and breaking out of that sandbox with some great APIs.

Merge Conflict: 246: Breaking out of the Desktop App Sandbox by Merge Conflict
items.description_markdown:
Putting apps into the app store is amazing, but the frameworks limit your ability as an app developer to do certain things on the desktop. We discuss how to keep long running processing going and breaking out of that sandbox with some great APIs.

[**Merge Conflict: 246: Breaking out of the Desktop App Sandbox**](https://www.mergeconflict.fm/246) by [Merge Conflict](https://www.mergeconflict.fm/)

embedded_links.title: **Merge Conflict: 246: Breaking out of the Desktop App Sandbox**

items.title: Merge Conflict: 247: Generating UI with GPT-3
items.description:
Frank goes hands on with GPT-3 for the first time and basically puts himself out of a job as he has it create his entire app for him. We discuss.

Merge Conflict: 247: Generating UI with GPT-3 by Merge Conflict
